page.title: 05Hamlets around Eastington
page.content:
CHIPPMAN'S PLATT _ formerly known as Chippenham Platt and before that as Shipman's Platt _ is on the former Stroudwater Canal and consists of 8 properties including the former parish Workhouse which is known locally as The Willows but is now the William Morris House owned and run by the William Morris Camphill Community as a hostel for mentally retarded people.
NEWTOWN _ consists of 7 properties on the bank of the canal. These houses used to be on either side of the main road connecting Stroud to the M5 Motorway until a recent road improvement scheme by-passed them leaving them in a quiet backwater.
